title: 111_hr3216
content: The "Local Television Freedom Act of 2009" may be cited as the short title. The Act addresses the carriage of stations in an adjacent underserved county under the Communications Act of 1934. The "Local Television Freedom Act of 2009" amends the Communications Act of 1934 regarding retransmission consent for television broadcast stations by multichannel video programming distributors in adjacent underserved counties. The "Local Television Freedom Act of 2009" amends the Communications Act of 1934 by restricting a television broadcast station's ability to request conditions for retransmission consent from multichannel video programming distributors in adjacent underserved counties. The "Local Television Freedom Act of 2009" mandates the FCC to establish rules for television broadcast station certification and amends regulations for network nonduplication protection, syndicated exclusivity protection, and sports. Additionally, it allows for the carriage of distant signals in adjacent underserved counties. The "Local Television Freedom Act of 2009" mandates FCC rules for television broadcast station certification and amends regulations for network nonduplication protection, syndicated exclusivity protection, and sports blackout protection. It permits retransmission of signals to subscribers in adjacent underserved counties. Regulations prohibit retransmission unless the distributor offers service in that county. The FCC must complete revised regulations within 180 days of the enactment of the "Local Television Freedom Act of 2009" to allow distributors to carry signals in counties where they offer service under specific sections of the Communications Act of 1934. SEC. 3. CARRIAGE OF STATIONS IN AN ADJACENT UNDERSERVED COUNTY UNDER THE COPYRIGHT ACT. Section 122 of title 17, United States Code is amended to include adjacent underserved counties in the definition of a station's local market for satellite carriers. This applies to various subsections and defines adjacent underserved county as a county with both commercial and noncommercial television broadcast stations. The term "adjacent market" refers to any local market partially in the same State as the station's community of license, for both commercial and noncommercial television broadcast stations. It includes counties within the station's adjacent market that meet specific criteria. The adjacent market of a county without in-State network stations is the nearest local market within the same State. Cable systems are amended to include secondary transmission to subscribers in adjacent underserved counties. Cable systems are amended to include secondary transmission to subscribers in adjacent underserved counties, in accordance with the same terms and conditions as apply under section 122.
